bug.author: dl002
bug.summary: No setupenv.cmd present in the folder
bug.description:
The installation docs <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/master/docs/install/windows_setup.md>here</denchmark-link> say the following at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/master/docs/install/windows_setup.md#installing-the-prebuilt-package-on-windows>Installing the Prebuilt Package on Windows</denchmark-link> .
Open the folder, and install the package by double-clicking setupenv.cmd. This sets up all of the environment variables required by MXNet.
However, there is no setupenv.cmd inside the folder. The installation guide is not clear on how to locate/ create setupenv.cmd.

comments.comment: truly there is no setupenv.cmd present in the folder. see <denchmark-link:https://discuss.mxnet.io/t/installing-mxnet-on-windows/374>https://discuss.mxnet.io/t/installing-mxnet-on-windows/374</denchmark-link> if you're still having issues installing or trying installing from source. the installation docs need to be updated to correct the stale info

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yzhliu>@yzhliu</denchmark-link> can we close out this issue? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dl002>@dl002</denchmark-link> feel free to reopen if you have follow up questions
